<Link id="l00699" /><CodeLine lineNumber="699"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If the other operand is a 8-bit immediate we should fold the immediate</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00700" /><CodeLine lineNumber="700"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instead. This reduces code size.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00701" /><CodeLine lineNumber="701"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// e.g.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00702" /><CodeLine lineNumber="702"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// movl 4(%esp), %eax</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00703" /><CodeLine lineNumber="703"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// addl $4, %eax</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00704" /><CodeLine lineNumber="704"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// vs.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00705" /><CodeLine lineNumber="705"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// movl $4, %eax</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00706" /><CodeLine lineNumber="706"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// addl 4(%esp), %eax</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00707" /><CodeLine lineNumber="707"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The former is 2 bytes shorter. In case where the increment is 1, then</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00708" /><CodeLine lineNumber="708"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the saving can be 4 bytes (by using incl %eax).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00709" /><CodeLine lineNumber="709"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;Imm = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;ConstantSDNode&gt;</a>(Op1)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00710" /><CodeLine lineNumber="710"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Imm-&gt;getAPIntValue().isSignedIntN(8))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00711" /><CodeLine lineNumber="711"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00712" /><CodeLine lineNumber="712"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00713" /><CodeLine lineNumber="713"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If this is a 64-bit AND with an immediate that fits in 32-bits,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00714" /><CodeLine lineNumber="714"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// prefer using the smaller and over folding the load. This is needed to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00715" /><CodeLine lineNumber="715"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// make sure immediates created by shrinkAndImmediate are always folded.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00716" /><CodeLine lineNumber="716"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Ideally we would narrow the load during DAG combine and get the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00717" /><CodeLine lineNumber="717"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// best of both worlds.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00718" /><CodeLine lineNumber="718"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (U-&gt;getOpcode() == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ac513a7da1bf74fb3e3c594da8534f2d2">ISD::AND</a> &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00719" /><CodeLine lineNumber="719"><Highlight kind="normal">            Imm-&gt;getAPIntValue().getBitWidth() == 64 &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00720" /><CodeLine lineNumber="720"><Highlight kind="normal">            Imm-&gt;getAPIntValue().isIntN(32))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00721" /><CodeLine lineNumber="721"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00722" /><CodeLine lineNumber="722"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00723" /><CodeLine lineNumber="723"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If this really a zext&#95;inreg that can be represented with a movzx</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00724" /><CodeLine lineNumber="724"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instruction, prefer that.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00725" /><CodeLine lineNumber="725"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// TODO: We could shrink the load and fold if it is non-volatile.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00726" /><CodeLine lineNumber="726"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (U-&gt;getOpcode() == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ac513a7da1bf74fb3e3c594da8534f2d2">ISD::AND</a> &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00727" /><CodeLine lineNumber="727"><Highlight kind="normal">            (Imm-&gt;getAPIntValue() == UINT8&#95;MAX ||</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00728" /><CodeLine lineNumber="728"><Highlight kind="normal">             Imm-&gt;getAPIntValue() == UINT16&#95;MAX ||</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00729" /><CodeLine lineNumber="729"><Highlight kind="normal">             Imm-&gt;getAPIntValue() == UINT32&#95;MAX))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00730" /><CodeLine lineNumber="730"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00746" /><CodeLine lineNumber="746"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// movl    %gs:0, %eax</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00936" /><CodeLine lineNumber="936"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00937" /><CodeLine lineNumber="937"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ENDBR32 and ENDBR64 have specific opcodes:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00938" /><CodeLine lineNumber="938"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ENDBR32: F3 0F 1E FB</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00939" /><CodeLine lineNumber="939"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ENDBR64: F3 0F 1E FA</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00940" /><CodeLine lineNumber="940"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// And we want that attackers won’t find unintended ENDBR32/64</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00941" /><CodeLine lineNumber="941"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// opcode matches in the binary</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00942" /><CodeLine lineNumber="942"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Here’s an example:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00943" /><CodeLine lineNumber="943"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If the compiler had to generate asm for the following code:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00944" /><CodeLine lineNumber="944"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// a = 4077854458</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00945" /><CodeLine lineNumber="945"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// it could, for example, generate:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00946" /><CodeLine lineNumber="946"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// mov 0xF30F1EFA, dword ptr&#91;a&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00947" /><CodeLine lineNumber="947"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In such a case, the binary would include a gadget that starts</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00948" /><CodeLine lineNumber="948"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// with a fake ENDBR64 opcode. Therefore, we split such generation</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00949" /><CodeLine lineNumber="949"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// into multiple operations, let it not shows in the binary</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00950" /><CodeLine lineNumber="950"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regcomp-c/#a0240ac851181b84ac374872dc5434ee4">N</a>-&gt;getOpcode() == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110aac2f0a84dd2aa5ee4c3f1385e9565f5e">ISD::Constant</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00983" /><CodeLine lineNumber="983"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00984" /><CodeLine lineNumber="984"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Convert vector increment or decrement to sub/add with an all-ones</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00985" /><CodeLine lineNumber="985"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// constant:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00986" /><CodeLine lineNumber="986"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// add X, &lt;1, 1...&gt; --&gt; sub X, &lt;-1, -1...&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00987" /><CodeLine lineNumber="987"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// sub X, &lt;1, 1...&gt; --&gt; add X, &lt;-1, -1...&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00988" /><CodeLine lineNumber="988"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The all-ones vector constant can be materialized using a pcmpeq</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00989" /><CodeLine lineNumber="989"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instruction that is commonly recognized as an idiom (has no register</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00990" /><CodeLine lineNumber="990"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// dependency), so that&#39;s better/smaller than loading a splat 1 constant.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00991" /><CodeLine lineNumber="991"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00992" /><CodeLine lineNumber="992"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// But don&#39;t do this if it would inhibit a potentially profitable load</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00993" /><CodeLine lineNumber="993"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// folding opportunity for the other operand. That only occurs with the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00994" /><CodeLine lineNumber="994"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// intersection of:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00995" /><CodeLine lineNumber="995"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (1) The other operand (op0) is load foldable.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00996" /><CodeLine lineNumber="996"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (2) The op is an add (otherwise, we are &#42;creating&#42; an add and can still</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00997" /><CodeLine lineNumber="997"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     load fold the other op).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00998" /><CodeLine lineNumber="998"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (3) The target has AVX (otherwise, we have a destructive add and can&#39;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00999" /><CodeLine lineNumber="999"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     load fold the other op without killing the constant op).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01000" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1000"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (4) The constant 1 vector has multiple uses (so it is profitable to load</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01001" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1001"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     into a register anyway).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01002" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1002"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> mayPreventLoadFold = &#91;&amp;&#93;() &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01003" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1003"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/x86/#aafd16108bb2bfb19eed47e23dcbee3dd">X86::mayFoldLoad</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regcomp-c/#a0240ac851181b84ac374872dc5434ee4">N</a>-&gt;getOperand(0), &#42;Subtarget) &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01004" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1004"><Highlight kind="normal">             <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regcomp-c/#a0240ac851181b84ac374872dc5434ee4">N</a>-&gt;getOpcode() == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a269996b43a1f3e1d1f84a70fd4387535">ISD::ADD</a> &amp;&amp; Subtarget-&gt;hasAVX() &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01005" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1005"><Highlight kind="normal">             !<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regcomp-c/#a0240ac851181b84ac374872dc5434ee4">N</a>-&gt;getOperand(1).hasOneUse();</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01838" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1838"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// extension for us and we can safely ignore the high bits of Offset.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01839" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1839"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Instructions with only a 32-bit immediate address do not, though: they</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01840" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1840"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// sign extend instead. This means only address the low 2GB of address space</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01841" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1841"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// is directly addressable, we need indirect addressing for the high 2GB of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01842" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1842"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// address space.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01843" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1843"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// TODO: Some of the earlier checks may be relaxed for ILP32 mode as the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01844" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1844"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// implicit zero extension of instructions would cover up any problem.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01845" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1845"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// However, we have asserts elsewhere that get triggered if we do, so keep</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01846" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1846"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the checks for now.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01847" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1847"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// TODO: We would actually be able to accept these, as well as the same</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01848" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1848"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// addresses in LP64 mode, by adding the EIZ pseudo-register as an operand</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01849" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1849"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to get an address size override to be emitted. However, this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01850" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1850"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// pseudo-register is not part of any register class and therefore causes</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01851" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1851"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// MIR verification to fail.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01852" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1852"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Subtarget-&gt;isTarget64BitILP32() &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2199"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Implement some heroics to detect shifts of masked values where the mask can</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2200"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// be replaced by extending the shift and undoing that in the addressing mode</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2201"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// scale. Patterns such as (shl (srl x, c1), c2) are canonicalized into (and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2202"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (srl x, SHIFT), MASK) by DAGCombines that don&#39;t know the shl can be done in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2203"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the addressing mode. This results in code such as:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2204"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2205"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   int f(short &#42;y, int &#42;lookup&#95;table) &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2206"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     ...</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2207"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     return &#42;y + lookup&#95;table&#91;&#42;y &gt;&gt; 11&#93;;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2208"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   &#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2209"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2210"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Turning into:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2211"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   movzwl (%rdi), %eax</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2212"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   movl %eax, %ecx</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2213"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   shrl $11, %ecx</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2214"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   addl (%rsi,%rcx,4), %eax</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2215"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2216"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Instead of:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2217"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   movzwl (%rdi), %eax</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2218"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   movl %eax, %ecx</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2219"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   shrl $9, %ecx</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2220"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   andl $124, %rcx</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2221"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   addl (%rsi,%rcx), %eax</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2222"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2223"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Note that this function assumes the mask is provided as a mask &#42;after&#42; the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2224"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// value is shifted. The input chain may or may not match that, but computing</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2225"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// such a mask is trivial.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2226" lineLink="#a06857829ce5f8610c6c44e45545212f4"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="#a06857829ce5f8610c6c44e45545212f4">foldMaskAndShiftToScale</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectiondag">SelectionDAG</a> &amp;DAG, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regcomp-c/#a0240ac851181b84ac374872dc5434ee4">N</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2227"><Highlight kind="normal">                                    uint64&#95;t Mask,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2228"><Highlight kind="normal">                                    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Shift, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/tablegenbackendskeleton-cpp/#ab60f28d7a141ac46ccc200176a1bca8b">X</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2229"><Highlight kind="normal">                                    <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-x86iseldagtodag-cpp-/x86iseladdressmode/#a682e2202c34ddb0bc4fba7020fa6159e">X86ISelAddressMode</a> &amp;AM) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2230"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Shift.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue/#ae779a9d142e6318d8fb0e4f0da32af0f">getOpcode</a>() != <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a3c6553c8acebe1b57c211ee45e2d8f98">ISD::SRL</a> || !Shift.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue/#a342c0d4e8e59b30daefe9a05bc2098bd">hasOneUse</a>() ||</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2231"><Highlight kind="normal">      !<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a92ca992e52dddc420f4b069cae06dfbe">isa&lt;ConstantSDNode&gt;</a>(Shift.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue/#a977e54da724d62e7b08e2ad69723731e">getOperand</a>(1)))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2232"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2233"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2235"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MaskIdx, MaskLen;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2236"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a582e08755c7a8d1b0bf6c5dcb765aaa8">isShiftedMask&#95;64</a>(Mask, MaskIdx, MaskLen))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2237"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2238"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MaskLZ = 64 - (MaskIdx + MaskLen);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2239"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2240"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ShiftAmt = Shift.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue/#ac969b6c833cfa44c1b4fcd5790268340">getConstantOperandVal</a>(1);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2241"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2242"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The amount of shift we&#39;re trying to fit into the addressing mode is taken</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2243"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// from the shifted mask index (number of trailing zeros of the mask).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2244"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> AMShiftAmt = MaskIdx;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2245"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2246"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// There is nothing we can do here unless the mask is removing some bits.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2247"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Also, the addressing mode can only represent shifts of 1, 2, or 3 bits.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2249"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03509" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3509"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  Visualization of Load-Op-Store fusion:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03510" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3510"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// -------------------------</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03511" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3511"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Legend:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03512" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3512"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    &#42;-lines = Chain operand dependencies.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03513" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3513"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    |-lines = Normal operand dependencies.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03514" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3514"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    Dependencies flow down and right. n-suffix references multiple nodes.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03515" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3515"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03516" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3516"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        C                        Xn  C</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03517" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3517"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        &#42;                         &#42;  &#42;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03518" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3518"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        &#42;                          &#42; &#42;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03519" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3519"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  Xn  A-LD    Yn                    TF         Yn</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03520" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3520"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   &#42;    &#42; \\   |                       &#42;        |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03521" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3521"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    &#42;   &#42;  \\  |                        &#42;       |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03522" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3522"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     &#42;  &#42;   \\ |             =&gt;       A--LD&#95;OP&#95;ST</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03523" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3523"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      &#42; &#42;    \\|                                 \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03524" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3524"><Highlight kind="comment">  //       TF    OP                                  \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03525" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3525"><Highlight kind="comment">  //         &#42;   | \\                                  Zn</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03526" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3526"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//          &#42;  |  \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03527" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3527"><Highlight kind="comment">  //         A-ST    Zn</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03528" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3528"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03529" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3529"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03530" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3530"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This merge induced dependences from: #1: Xn -&gt; LD, OP, Zn</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03531" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3531"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//                                      #2: Yn -&gt; LD</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03532" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3532"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//                                      #3: ST -&gt; Zn</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03533" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3533"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03534" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3534"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Ensure the transform is safe by checking for the dual</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03535" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3535"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// dependencies to make sure we do not induce a loop.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03536" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3536"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03537" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3537"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// As LD is a predecessor to both OP and ST we can do this by checking:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03538" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3538"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  a). if LD is a predecessor to a member of Xn or Yn.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03539" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3539"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  b). if a Zn is a predecessor to ST.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03540" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3540"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03541" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3541"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// However, (b) can only occur through being a chain predecessor to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03542" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3542"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ST, which is the same as Zn being a member or predecessor of Xn,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03543" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3543"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// which is a subset of LD being a predecessor of Xn. So it&#39;s</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03544" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3544"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// subsumed by check (a).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03545" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3545"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03546" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3546"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Chain = StoreNode-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memsdnode/#ab858661e16a61c4fc6b27b6b26aac17b">getChain</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03547" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3547"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03548" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3548"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Gather X elements in ChainOps.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03549" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3549"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Chain == Load.getValue(1)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03550" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3550"><Highlight kind="normal">    FoundLoad = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03556" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3556"><Highlight kind="normal">        FoundLoad = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03563" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3563"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03584" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3584"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Change a chain of &#123;load; op; store&#125; of the same value into a simple op</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03585" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3585"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// through memory of that value, if the uses of the modified value and its</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03586" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3586"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// address are suitable.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03587" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3587"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03588" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3588"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The tablegen pattern memory operand pattern is currently not able to match</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03589" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3589"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the case where the EFLAGS on the original operation are used.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03590" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3590"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03591" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3591"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// To move this to tablegen, we&#39;ll need to improve tablegen to allow flags to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03592" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3592"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// be transferred from a node in the pattern to the result node, probably with</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03593" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3593"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// a new keyword. For example, we have this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03594" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3594"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// def DEC64m : RI&lt;0xFF, MRM1m, (outs), (ins i64mem:$dst), &quot;dec&#123;q&#125;\\t$dst&quot;,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03595" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3595"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  &#91;(store (add (loadi64 addr:$dst), -1), addr:$dst)&#93;&gt;;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03596" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3596"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// but maybe need something like this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03597" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3597"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// def DEC64m : RI&lt;0xFF, MRM1m, (outs), (ins i64mem:$dst), &quot;dec&#123;q&#125;\\t$dst&quot;,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03598" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3598"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  &#91;(store (X86add&#95;flag (loadi64 addr:$dst), -1), addr:$dst),</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03599" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3599"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   (transferrable EFLAGS)&#93;&gt;;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03600" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3600"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03601" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3601"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Until then, we manually fold these and instruction select the operation</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03602" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3602"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// here.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l04805" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4805"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// implicit zeroing of 32 bit ops. So we should check if the lower 32 bits</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04806" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4806"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// are negative too.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04807" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4807"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> MaskVal = And1C-&gt;getAPIntValue();</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l04812" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4812"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Don&#39;t extend into the upper 32 bits of a 64 bit mask.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04813" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4813"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (VT == MVT::i64 &amp;&amp; MaskLZ &gt;= 32) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
